overview:
Jesse Forrest is Co-Founder & CTO at FindSportsNow. In this role, Jesse oversees development on the FindSportsNow platform, which includes both software development and hardware infrastructure. He also serves as Co-Founder & CTO at Joimo, a national organization that offers sports and recreational activities to the community. He previously served as a technical lead at Sometrics, which was acquired by American Express in September 2011.

With years of experience working with web-based technologies, Forrest established FindSportsNow to help event coordinators easily promote their events and activities. The company’s platform additionally allows coordinators to accept payments online via FindSportsNow’s Online Registration System.

Under Forrest’s leadership, FindSportsNow launched the industry’s first in-page online registration platform. Event coordinators are able to put one snippet of code on their website and they can have a fully functional online registration window on their site. Their participants never need to leave their website to sign up for their events and activities.

In the first year of launch, the FindSportsNow’s Online Registration System successfully transacted over a quarter million USD. Jesse is helping FindSportsNow break into new territory by focusing the technology on more eccentric activities, ranging from Archery to Zip Lining.

Prior to the launch of FindSportsNow and the acquisition of Sometrics by American Express, Forrest was a software developer with a top-secret security clearance for Northrop Grumman Corporation. He was instrumental at developing AJAX web applications that could help assist in automated code generation.

Forrest often advises startups with their technology related issues.
